body: Thanks, yes, this should be handled better.

issue.title: Make sure SpiderTask notifies, always, when done

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change SpiderTask to notify the Spider in a finally block to ensure it
always notifies that it has completed.

Fix #4428 - ZAP waiting for Spider endlessly when it crashed

(Note that this does not fix the DB cache issue and related exceptions.)

issue.title: ZAP gets stuck because of spider crash

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
While scanning a target, ZAP spider crash due to Data cache size limit, because of a throwed exception. 
**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run Spider 

**Software versions**
 - ZAP: 2.7.0
 - OS: Ubuntu 16.10
 - Java: 1.8.0_91

body: I just ran into this exact same problem with the 2.8.0 release.  Did something revert?

I'm trying to think what I can add that isn't already here --  I attempted to spider, it got to around 86% and got stuck.  Console output showed data cache size limit exceptions:
```
Caused by: org.hsqldb.HsqlException: Data cache size limit is reached: 10000
```
Followed by:
```
501498 [ZAP-SpiderThreadPool-0-thread-2] ERROR org.zaproxy.zap.ZAP$UncaughtExceptionLogger  - Exception in thread "ZAP-SpiderThreadPool-0-thread-2"
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider.SpiderScan.notifySpiderTaskResult(SpiderScan.java:359)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.Spider.notifyListenersSpiderTaskResult(Spider.java:845)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderTask.runImpl(SpiderTask.java:248)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderTask.run(SpiderTask.java:190)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
```

I bumped up the data cache size to fix.

> I bumped up the data cache size to fix.

That's fine as a work around, we've suggested that to people in the past. It's pretty rarely encountered (from my memory anyway).

What's odd is I didn't run into that in my previous month's scan or from any of the other scans I did using the weekly releases (or I didn't notice it because it somehow timedout and continued?).  That's why I thought maybe something reverted.

The one difference I can think of besides the little changes that happen to our web app each month is that amazon was blocking port 80 access and zap was having trouble connecting to the relevant urls.  Is it possible this could affect the data cache somehow?

> I'm trying to think what I can add that isn't already here

The question might seem pointless but I verified the fix then and just now with 2.8.0 and the spider does not get stuck:
```
87445 [ZAP-SpiderThreadPool-3-thread-2] ERROR org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider.SpiderThread  - java.sql.SQLException: Data cache size limit is reached: 100
org.parosproxy.paros.db.DatabaseException: java.sql.SQLException: Data cache size limit is reached: 100
	at org.parosproxy.paros.db.paros.ParosTableHistory.write(ParosTableHistory.java:443)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.model.HistoryReference.<init>(HistoryReference.java:368)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider.SpiderThread.notifySpiderTaskResult(SpiderThread.java:509)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.Spider.notifyListenersSpiderTaskResult(Spider.java:845)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderTask.runImpl(SpiderTask.java:248)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderTask.run(SpiderTask.java:190)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Data cache size limit is reached: 100
	at org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCUtil.sqlException(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCUtil.sqlException(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCPreparedStatement.fetchResult(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(Unknown Source)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.db.paros.ParosTableHistory.write(ParosTableHistory.java:515)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.db.paros.ParosTableHistory.write(ParosTableHistory.java:427)
	... 8 more
Caused by: org.hsqldb.HsqlException: Data cache size limit is reached: 100
	at org.hsqldb.error.Error.error(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.error.Error.error(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.persist.Cache.put(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.persist.DataFileCache.add(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.persist.RowStoreAVLDisk.add(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.persist.RowStoreAVLDisk.getNewCachedObject(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.Table.insertSingleRow(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.StatementDML.insertSingleRow(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.StatementInsert.getResult(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.StatementDMQL.execute(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.Session.executeCompiledStatement(Unknown Source)
	at org.hsqldb.Session.execute(Unknown Source)
	... 12 more
87511 [ZAP-SpiderThreadPool-3-thread-2] ERROR org.zaproxy.zap.ZAP$UncaughtExceptionLogger  - Exception in thread "ZAP-SpiderThreadPool-3-thread-2"
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider.SpiderScan.notifySpiderTaskResult(SpiderScan.java:359)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.Spider.notifyListenersSpiderTaskResult(Spider.java:845)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderTask.runImpl(SpiderTask.java:248)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.spider.SpiderTask.run(SpiderTask.java:190)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
88900 [ZAP-SpiderThreadPool-3-thread-4] INFO org.zaproxy.zap.spider.Spider  - Spidering process is complete. Shutting down...
88901 [ZAP-SpiderShutdownThread-3] INFO org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider.SpiderThread  - Spider scanning complete: true
```

So, there must be something slightly different causing the spider to get stuck in your case. I'll check the code and try to reproduce that.

> Followed by:

Is that the very last exception in the log? Is there a previous `NullPointerException`?
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
